page.title: 03The Policing of Alderney II
page.content: People who have done something wrong are put in the jail until they are put before the court.After that he does or goes wherever the court says.Most people who commit crimes go to Guernsey.The worst crime that has been committed in Alderney in 1985 has been the possession of narcotics(drugs).The largest fine from the Alderney court is Â£100 on one charge.The vehicle that they use is a Landrover (AY999-AY being the registration letters denoting Alderney).There are about 1950 motor vehicles on Alderney.The licensing hours permitted are ,summer 1000-0100 hours;winter 1000-2400 hours with shorter hours on Sundays.The police job is very much that of "community policing" as most people on the island know each other.
